title: Drawing, "Valley with a Bridge and Houses, near Guaranda, Ecuador", June 5, 1857
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper
markings: Stamped in ink, at lower left:  Lugt 457c
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite with numbers at various locations; again, at lower center:  2- Brown Tree / 3- yellow flowers; and at lower right:  near Guaranda June 5th // 57 / Rich banks of earth stones bluish / and all colors.
description:
Recto:  Horizontal view of a valley with a bridge covered stream flowing and cascading from central left foreground around past a house at center and eventually disappearing into the central middleground, while several houses stand upon a hill in the right background beneath mountain ranges which encompass the valley.

Verso: Unfinished vertical sketch, in the opposite direction, of a high mountain rising over foothills.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Valley with a Bridge and Houses, near Guaranda, Ecuador", June 5, 1857.
June 5, 1857. Graphite, brush and white gouache on gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-203.
